instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]MBP retina 2015 13’' <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won’t sleep
threads.message: Got a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 model with liquid damage around <CHIP>U3310</CHIP>, replaced a few burned components. The MacBook works perfect, it just won’t sleep when the lid is shut. any ideas what it could be?

threads.title: [SOLVED]MBP retina 2015 13’' <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won’t sleep
threads.message:
The magnetic sensor is right next door at J5250.

Have you measured <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> with the lid up and down?

threads.title: [SOLVED]MBP retina 2015 13’' <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won’t sleep
threads.message: Figured it was J5250, I just accidentally ripped it off just now, taking off all the pads except one. luckily most of them are not connected or ground. I have stuck it down with 2 jumpers on pin 6 and 7 also replaced <RESISTOR>R5250</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C5250</CAPACITOR>. still no luck

threads.title: [SOLVED]MBP retina 2015 13’' <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won’t sleep
threads.message: Hold a magnet over the sensor and see if <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> goes low. Check voltages on the Hall sensor chip.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MBP retina 2015 13’' <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won’t sleep
threads.message: Fixed the issue. problem was pin 6. although the pad was there the trace was fucked, i put a jumper.
